Aggregate a Ranges object

Aggregate a Ranges object

# S3 method for GenomicRanges
summarise(.data, ...)

# S3 method for Ranges
summarise(.data, ...)

# S3 method for GRangesGrouped
summarise(.data, ...)

# S3 method for IRangesGrouped
summarise(.data, ...)

Arguments

.data

a Ranges object
...

Name-value pairs of summary functions.

Value

a DataFrame

Examples

df <- data.frame(start = 1:10, width = 5,  seqnames = "seq1",
strand = sample(c("+", "-", "*"), 10, replace = TRUE), gc = runif(10))
rng <- as_granges(df)
rng %>% summarise(gc = mean(gc))
#> DataFrame with 1 row and 1 column
#>          gc
#>   <numeric>
#> 1 0.4832691
rng %>% group_by(strand) %>% summarise(gc = mean(gc))
#> DataFrame with 2 rows and 2 columns
#>     strand        gc
#>   <factor> <numeric>
#> 1        + 0.4090847
#> 2        * 0.5327254
